snippet: Last week, England’s Premier League began the formal process of seeking more money from networks at home and abroad that want to broadcast its soccer games.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column observes that England’s Premier League has started testing its value as television property; notes its first phase is seeking bids from news media companies that want British rights to soccer games starting with 2016-17 season.
lead_paragraph: Last week, England’s Premier League began the formal process of seeking more money from networks at home and abroad that want to broadcast its soccer games.

headline.print_headline: Premier League Success to Come at a Higher Price
headline.main: In Seeking TV Bids, Premier League Controls the Ball
